contentrichtext.text: [[File:Quatt - St Andrew's Church - geograph.org.uk - 167647.jpg|thumb|240px|St Andrew's church, Quatt, Shropshire.]] '''Quatt''' is a small village in [[Shropshire]], [[England]] in the [[Severn Valley (England)|Severn Valley]]. The [[civil parish]], formally known as '''Quatt Malvern''', has a population of 219 according to the 2001 census. It lies on the [[A442 road|A442]] south of [[Bridgnorth]]. There are places to visit like Quatt Village Hall and activities to take part in, from the local [http://www.quattcc.co.uk Cricket Club] to Bell Ringing. ==External links== {{Commons category inline|Quatt}} {{shropshire}} {{Shropshire-geo-stub}} {{coord|52|29|N|2|21|W|region:GB_type:city|display=title}} {{Severn from Ironbridge to Bewdley}} [[Category:Villages in Shropshire]] [[Category:Civil parishes in Shropshire]]
